author: Andreas Spiess
description:
Auto-detecting hardware isn’t just a neat trick—it makes our projects smarter, simpler, and more user-friendly. It’s a win for both users and developers. Let’s see how we can build it.
I built a GPS-driven NTP server with an ESP32. No need for a Raspberry Pi anymore...

My second channel: https://www.youtube.com/HB9BLAWireless

Links:
Lilygo PoE board: https://s.click.aliexpress.com/e/_oFGdz3P or https://amzn.to/4bstn7z
WT32-ETH01: https://s.click.aliexpress.com/e/_ooW9OMz or https://amzn.to/4id0W04
My preferred ESP32 Devboard: https://s.click.aliexpress.com/e/_oD0D3LJ
Files: https://github.com/SensorsIot/Autodetecting-boards/tree/main

title: Mastering Smart Board Auto-Detection for Microcontrollers. including ESP32 GPS NTP server
